intro: Psychotria spathicalyx, commonly known as the white-veined psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers with prominent veins. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique appearance and potential pharmacological properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
